author: Todd Haselton
title: How to make Amazon Alexa default assistant on Android phones
text:
CNBC.com Rex Curry | Reuters
You can now use Amazon 's Alexa instead of Google Assistant by default on your Android phone.
The new option was noticed by a user on Reddit over the weekend.
That means you can hold the home button and pull up Alexa. This is particularly compelling if you own an Amazon Echo at home, where you might already be used to using Alexa to check the weather, play the news or add goods to your shopping list.
I'll show you how. How to use Alexa instead of Google Assistant on your Android phone Todd Haselton | CNBC Select Alexa from the menu in Android Download the Amazon Alexa app from the Google Play Store. Open it and sign in to your Amazon account. Open Settings on your Android phone Open Apps
